column2: Tottums, 75 or over on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is to serve as a warning about this eye drop.  I had a severe reaction to it in the form of Vertigo and vomiting and inability to walk.  I had used more than the prescribed amount for persistent itching eyes.  My reaction was very frightening and resulted in $1,777 ambulance ride to ER.  No bill yet for med. treatment.  I have since read online the severeside effects this drug and cause.

column2: me, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have dry eye syndrome unresponsive to Restasis. This seems to be helping although I don't know why.

column2: Michael, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am using Pataday 0.2% drops for foreign body sensation.  However the cost is so high I am seeking an alternative.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: What relief I received from the itching was vastly offset by the discomfort that came from my eyelids getting dry & crusty.  It cost me $50 with my insurance - was so not worth it. Feel like I wasted my money.

column2: Beansprout, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After using the eye drop for 24 hours, I noticed crusty flakes around my eye.  After 48 hours, the crusty flakes occurred throughout the day.  72 hours after using the eye drops, I had a sudden severe sore throat that eventually subsided.  After 4 days of using the drug, I had a sudden coughing attack that was similiar to an asthma attack.  I read the side effects and immediately stopped taking the drug.  I would NOT recommend this drug to anyone.  It should be removed from the market.

column2: loom, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It seems most do not understand what this drug is. It is NOT for instant relief. It is an antihistamine, it takes several doses before it is effective and one must stay on it. ONE drop in each eye daily.'-aday' get it? I occasionally get allergies bad enough to swell my eyes shut. As long as I start it before the allergy season and maintain I am golden. If you just have mild itchy eyes I don't believe this product is worth it. I've had my eyes itch so much from allergies that I have woke up with bruising from rubbing them in my sleep, so the cost is well worth it to me. If it works but seems to cause some irritation try Patanol. It's less concentrated so you have to take it TWICE a day but your eyes don't get the full blast at once.

column2: peggy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It has hellp me to stop rubbing my eyes so much

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It lasted 3-4 days, was supposed to last 30 days.  Not sure if I used 2 drops on 2 of the days (had also used a sample bottle).  The bottle is white, so you don't know if you're getting the right amount.  Rx is 2.5 ml. and sample is .5 ml, so again, how do you know how much you got?  It cost $143.99; what a racket!  Have contacted the FDA about this issue.  $143.99 and they can't afford a bottle that lets you see what you're getting???????

column2: allergysefferer, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: 8 year old son has severe seasonal allergies, on oral meds but continues to have symptoms.  Using this combined with oral meds has relieved nearly all his symptoms and he is more than happy to let me apply drops!  The price is high and am lucky that insurance covers some.  Totally worth every penny.

column2: AW, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Using this for allergies...works ok at first, then I get a headache and hazy blurred vision, and itching comes back just a couple hours later.

column2: Mpippin, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Havent had a chance to use it because couldnt afford it! Insurance (united healthcare of the river valley) does not cover it and the cost was $147.99! Seriously? In this day and time, no medications should cost that much, let alone eye drops!
TOO EXPENSIVE!  My insurance doesn't cover it.  $129 for one bottle!  It seems to work for now, but there has got to be something less expensive.

column2: Devara, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got this prescription for itchy, red eyes.  It has helped with the itch, but my eyes are just as bloodshot and uncomfortable as before.  Now they're dry and they ache.  Fortunately I have good insurance and only paid $20, but I'd be willing to pay more for something that actually worked.

column2: kelly, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Yes this worked for the eye allergies, but after about 3 weeks of use, I have had horrible body aches, sore throat, running nose....couldn't figure it out, well looked up the side effects of Pataday...Bingo!!! Will never use this product again!

column2: myates, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have only used these eye drops a few times. My main symptoms are redness, irritation and extreme sensitivity to light. They do seem to work when you first put them in, but they do not last very long. Within 3 or 4 hrs, my symptoms come back. So I use OTC eye drops the rest of the day.

column2: Kel2ie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

column2: noluck, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: did not prevent crust from forming on eye lids

column2: juliannc99, 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I am a post bone marrow transplant patient with dry, red, itchy and swollen eyes as a side effect.  This product made my vision blurr and "stung" when administered.  I used it at night and the swelling did reduce though as well as the gritty "sand" on my lashes in the morning.  WAY TO EXPENSIVE FOR THE TINY AMOUNT YOU RECEIVE.  I thought the tiny bottle my doctor gave me was "sample" size and was shocked when I went to have it refilled and it was the same size!!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: patadayyyyy, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: to all those people who are saying this treatment is too expensive: I paid thirty dollars for this! and yes it's 2.5 mL!  u pay around 100 dollars only if u don't have insurance! I have united healthcare and I paid thirty dollars. one eye drop does it all. the itchiness goes away INSTANTLY! I'm so glad I found this! so all people out there: cechk if ur insurance covers pataday!

column2: MITTIE, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: THESE ARE THE BEST EYE DROPS I HAVE EVER USED THEY DO NOT BURN YOUR EYES LIKE THE OTHER DROPS I HAVE TRIED.  THEY ALSO GIVE YOU INSTANT RELIEF. I HAVE BEEN USING THESE FOR SEVERAL YEARS WITH NO SIDE EFFECTS.  I COULD NOT MAKE IT THROUGH THE ALERGY SESION WITHOUT THEM.

column2: love spring, hate allergies,  Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Patanol/pataday has been borderline effective for me.Low strength steriod eye drops, e.g. Alrex, (in conjuction with nasal steriod spray) has been much more effective than any antihistamine eye drop/oral medication combination I've tried.  In fact, once I switched to nasal steroid spray, my eye symptoms got better as well and only use the eye steroid drops during the worst parts of the season (risk of glaucoma).Hope this helps.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
egbok, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hey Guys.  I don't see what the fuss is all about.  First of all, I have used this whenever Allergy season begins and it works like a gem.  A few days in it goes away and I am fine.  As far as expense, it shouldn't cost a dime.  You should ask your eye doctor for a sample tiny bottle.  I have never paid for one and they last a long time.  One bottle, very small, contains a lot of liquid which last me at least six months, entire allergy season at no cost.  Don't get ripped off by any Doctors or your Insurance Medical Hospital.  Go to an optometrist.

column2: activewoman, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I experience itchy eyes from airborne allergies.  I also have periodic iritis episodes normally treated with steroid drops. While pataday was not prescribed for the iritis, I have found that often if I use pataday immediately upon sensing possible iritis symptoms, that problem doesn't develop.  Perhaps this is coincidence but have wondered for years if there was not an allergic component to iritis.  Pataday works immediately for the itchy eyes. I have experienced no negative side effects.  My satisfaction, however, is effected by the extremely high price of this medication.  Unlike some other reviewers,I do only have to pay a copay, $25, but according to the pharmacy the size bottle this is sold in is supposed to be a 7 day supply.  Fortunately I do not use this daily and can go for months without needing it, depending on allergens in the air.

column2: DebinMissouri, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I noticed immediately how dry my eyes became and my vision was still blurry. Then I noticed how tired I was becoming, I just can't get enough sleep. The worst part is the depression. It started about a week after beginning the drops and I've spent days in tears and I can't even blame PMS. And on top of it, the price was enough to put me into cardiac arrest $170!! I won't be refilling this prescription!

column2: rekritr, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Tremendous results after years of treatment for bacterial infections, this drug (as you know) treats allergic symptoms. Very satisfied after one application I had results.

column2: ooxxoo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had the worst side effects. Apparently, i have a sensitivity and actually did have the flu like symptoms that was written on the drug facts. and as for the price, i heard its expensive. but i was lucky to get it for free.

column2: swolleneyes, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My eyes got so red and dry that I had to stop using the drops after 2 days and had to use dry eye drops for 4 days later.  Hated it.

column2: redeye, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: To bad this worked so well, because the cost of $109.00 is too costley for me as a retired senior.  I didn't quite qualify for alcon drug discount program.  Looking for other eye drops that may be as effective.

column2: Sheila, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm on this drug only 4 days and ONLY because I have to temporarily stop taking Loratadine or ZYRTEC antihistamine pills while the allergist do the patch tests on me within 9 days. LUCKILY FOR ALL OF US, we do not have to use this at all. Loratadine or Zyrtec is enough.  If your insurance does not pay for Zyrtec, ask your doc  for the generic drug for Zyrtec -- CETIRIZINE HCL, 10 mg tablets, paid for by most insurers. It is also available over the counter at Rite-Aid for $23.00 (30 tabs).Many people would never think of taking pills for horribly itchy eyes or eczema, BUT these pills are the SECRET SOLUTION TO OUR ALLERGY PROBLEMS -- Claritin has also eye drops for itchy eyes, aside from their Loratadine. My ophthalmologist did not tell me right away about this -- I suffered 3 weeks before I found out from friends/health pros this is what is going on now.

column2: BES, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had relief after one dose.  It was remarkable since I suffered for years using over the counter drops to no avail.  My insurance refuses to pay for this drug so I don't know how long I can use it as it is terribly expensive.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Seems to stop itchiness/grittiness very quickly but doesn't seem to provide long-term relief. Might even cause dry eyes to worsen. Needed genteal soon after.$50 co-pay!!! Way too pricey.Will never use or refill again.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Outrageously expensive. There has got to be something out there that works better than this. I've bought 2 bottles thinking that it works somewhat, but I'm ready to give up and try something else.

column2: Pataday NJ Girl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: During allergy season I cannot wear  my contacts unless I use Pataday.  I have tried many other eye drops, but Pataday is the only thing that works for me.  The drops do irritate my eyes if I administer them in the morning, but not if I put them in at night.  Bought a 3 month supply from www.medstoreinternational.com for the price of 1 month.  It is well worth the money in my opinion.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Jennifer, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My son is using this medication.  He is 4.  His eyes get so red as soon as anything starts blooming in the spring.  It keeps his eyes from swelling shut but it does not keep them from getting red and itchy.  It is the best thing we have found so far though.
